name: K8s - DaemonSet MisScheduled Pods in Kube-System

alertDefProperties.name: K8s - DaemonSet MisScheduled Pods in Kube-System
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert is triggered when a DaemonSet in a Kubernetes cluster fails to schedule its pods on the expected nodes, indicating potential issues with node availability, resource constraints, or DaemonSet configuration. 

Action: Investigate the reason for DaemonSet pod mis-scheduling. Common causes include:
      - Insufficient resources on nodes (e.g., CPU, memory, disk)
      - Node taints or labels preventing pod scheduling
      - Resource limits in DaemonSet configurations that prevent pods from fitting on available nodes
      - DaemonSet selector or node affinity misconfigurations
    Address the underlying issue by reviewing node conditions, updating resource requests, or adjusting scheduling constraints to ensure proper pod placement.
